help-file.title: KENON
help-file.content: Realizing their mistake with the Kvark language script, the coders modified it to produce more coherent English. Though much easier to understand, the Kenon language script is also not without its flaws. Due to memory restrictions, the range of Kenons pronouncements is rather limited. This often causes Kenon to repeat itself multiple times like a broken record because it is incapable of storing more than one response at a time. Upon reboot Kenon develops a new grammatically correct response it repeats until its next reboot weeks later. With the coders growing skills, and the ability to learn from the past failures of both the Kvark and Kenon scripts, the next attempt at an intelligent language script should be successful.
